meanings.definition: To increase the value of something.
meanings.sent1: I will revalue my old toys before selling them.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to revalue their assets after a successful year.
meanings.sent3: When I revalue my collection, I feel like a treasure hunter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness revalued my opinion of her.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to revalue the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To reassess the value of something.
meanings.sent1: It's important to revalue your goals regularly to stay on track.
meanings.sent2: The appraiser will revalue the antique vase to determine its current worth.
meanings.sent3: I had to revalue my decision after hearing new information.
meanings.sent4: His words made me revalue my priorities in life.
meanings.sent5: The storm's destruction made us revalue the importance of preparedness.
